text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for your review of the new
classics album Hanging Gardens classics
is a California electronic music duo
this is their full-length debut LP and
according to NPR music who was streaming
this LP pretty recently they are in fact
childhood friends who have been making
music for quite a while now they have
some new singles out from the cell P
they've also got some remixes commercial
remixes under their belts as well but
this LP is really their first big outing
it's on innovative leisure and
stylistically what we have here are a
series of tracks that are pretty much
just very bouncy bouncy house music
electronic dance music with a strong
retro vibe that feeling is definitely in
the air thanks to some recent releases
like Daft Punk's random access memories
and there are some other spots on this
LP where the instrumentals remind me of
this very warped strange otherworldly
nostalgic sensation that I would
typically get from something like
chillwave music though this is
definitely not as experimental or it is
hazy
I think Hanging Gardens functions off
some very similar sentimental notions
the grooves and the attitude that
classics brings to the table reminds me
of many a release from DFA records
especially the one track on here that
actually features Nancy Wang on vocals
however even though I do compare this LP
a little bit to some DFA releases
classics definitely Nyx's the grit the
urgency and the sort of Punk edge that
releases on that label typically burn
instead the beats the synthesizers and
shimmering glistening piano chords on
this LP add up into what is dance
music's take on a smooth sailing sunny
day it's Beach weather in the 80s in
Southern California and as a result a
number of tracks off of this LP are mint
yes
mint dance tracks that are worthy of
inclusion in many many DJ sets tracks
like all you're waiting for with Nancy
Wang and I'll get you with chip Depp
these tracks have snappy snappy beats
and cyntha melodies that are so sweet
and sticky it's like a drippy melting
popsicle yet and then I want to lick it
oh you're waiting for the vocal features
on these tracks to me are just really
confident they're bold they stick out
I love the single holding on off of this
LP - there's some really sort of cheesy
80s synth riffs soaring strings a punchy
beat really great bouncy piano chords to
me this track honestly feels like
classics grabbed a little piece of each
instrument from the hit song TV killed
the radiostar and made some kind of
weird house remix of it that was so
manipulated it didn't even really sound
like its source material these are just
really sharp dance tracks in my opinion
however there are other songs on here
that are either so short they are so
lacking in progression or they're so
reverb heavy that they lack bayi
it's to a point where if any of these
tracks were to be played out in my
opinion they would only be interesting
as a transition toward something else
tracks like rhythm Santa Clara as well
as the song Domino's and two other
tracks on this LP - that also have vocal
features sadly the song long lost which
features active child and a stranger
love with Sara turn off both of these
tracks while they're not terrible
songwriting wise there are so much
reverb especially laid onto the vocals
in these songs that really sort of sucks
the life in the body out of the voices
especially active child whose solo
material I have enjoyed I know from
previous recordings his voice has quite
a bit of body to it so I'm kind of
shocked to hear it sounding so thin and
and borderline lifeless on Hanging
Gardens overall I do have to say this is
a pleasant enough dance album with some
real highlights and a few potholes as
well there are quite a few sunny smooth
and kind of beachfront inspired tracks
on this LP put this album on and you
will smell the ocean air I just feel
like there needs to be a few more punchy
tracks on here like the song super
nature which is a pretty hard edged
piece of electro funk and the closer on
here
a somewhat catchy and kind of sensual
piece of synthesizer pop they're just a
good handful of tracks on this LP that
in my opinion are kind of like
dancefloor wallpaper they're fine while
they're on but I don't really miss them
when they're gone I'm kind of feeling a
light to decent sex on this album if
you've given it a listen what did you
think of it did you love it did you hate
it why that's it this review is my
opinion if you don't like it here's a
straw I want to give a shout out to
Michelle Tony Brody Brody Brody fruit
flies in my apartment and Jeremy only
the strong subscribe all mistakes were
intentional Anthony Fantana classics
Hanging Gardens forever
